intro: Weatherbya damunensis, commonly known as the Damunensis weatherbya, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
